result.execSummary:
The defendant Laquonish Shontial Harris was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Court ordered a fine of $25.00 and surcharge imposed due within 2 months. Cash on deposit to be applied. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Any remaining balance to be returend to the remitter. 
Court WAIVED all other costs, fees due to inability to pay. 
Provide a DNA sample

Credit for 60 days. TIME SERVED DISPOSITION
Concurrent with: sentence in Case 16CF449

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.   

Court ordered defendant to serve 60 days in the House of Correction CONCURRENT to sentence in 16CF449 with 60 days credit for time served.  TIME SERVED DISPOSITION.

Court ordered a fine of $25.00 and surcharge IMPOSED due within  2 months. Cash on deposit to be applied.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
Any remaining balance to be returned to the remitter.

Court waived all other costs, fees  due to inability to pay.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample

Attorney Arial J. Rosenberg in court, defendant Laquonish Shontial Harris not in court, in custody.  Jack A. Pitzo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: sm  
Case in court for plea and sentencing hearing. Parties have reached a resolution. State placed negotiations on the record. Defense counsel and defendant confirms. 
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law.



Plea hearing held

AS TO COUNT 1
Defendant changes her plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to her plea, advised of herConstitutional rights and the maximum penalty.   Defendant advised that if she is not a United States Citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived her rights.    Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.    Court ordered a DNA sample and advised defendant of applicable surcharge.


Upon the motion of the State, court ordered the enhancer( repeater) dismissed
